name: Forty Putney Road Bed and Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is a gem. The room was lovely. The bed and linens were very nice and comfortable. Breakfast was very good - awesome waffles one day, quiche and a yogurt parfait the next day. The service and their attentiveness was great too. They have thought of all the details and were willing to help with anything we needed - dinner reservations, suggestions for things to do, etc. Nice jazz music playing throughout the house. There is the greatest little pub inside the house that serves great local beers and good wine. The owners, though young, really have it together. Fun to talk to. This was a great find and one I would revisit in a heart beat. I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great Place - 40 Putney Rd

likes.liked: — It was a great house. Very comfortable.

reviews.title: A Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed for 4 days and I have never left a vacation feeling more relaxed. Sitting in the pub and chatting with Tim was a great way to unwind after our 6 hour drive. The room was tastefully decorated - cozy without being kitchy - and comfortable. The jazz music that was playing on the radio as we entered our room was a warm touch and set the tone for the rest of our stay. Each morning, we woke up to an amazing breakfast (I definitley missed it this morning now that I'm back home) which we ate outside surrounded by the beauty and serenity of the garden. Downtown Brattleboro is about a 10 minute walk from the b&b, as is hiking and kayaking. We wish Amy and Tim the best of luck with their new venture and look forward to returning!!

I had to book a place last minute for business travel and stumbled upon Forty Putney searching a couple websites. I usually dont stay at B&B's but it looked great online so I took a chance. I am already trying to pick a weekend and go back for pleasure!! Tim and Amy are super friendly and passionate about their home. Location is perfect for a nice stroll downtown. Highly recommend to anyone traveling to Brattleboro.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — Decor, original touches with modern updates, private bath, good layout

reviews.title: We had a great stay at Forty Putney Road B&B
reviews.text: Every aspect of this inn is great - it's within walking distance to town, our room was charming and spacious yet comfortable and the breakfasts were absolutely delicious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tim and Amy are thoughtful and friendly hosts and made our experience very enjoyable. And, they have a small pub and a pool table so it's a place that both of us enjoyed.
reviews.title: Could Not Have Been Better! =)

likes.disliked: — If I had to pick, price. But we got what we paid for!

reviews.text: My mom and I stayed at Forty Putney Road during our driving tour of Vermont & Maine. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived to find a fabulous room with fireplace, fridge, and warm cookies. The place was amazingly clean, tidy and furnished with a comfortable, yet elegant decor. The owners, Tim & Amy, provided a wealth of information on the immediate area and the state overall. The B&B boasts its own pub on the first floor, complete with multiple tables, a long bar, and great menu. Amy's breakfasts were varied, delicious, and representative of local produce and ingredients. I can't say enough positive comments about Forty Putney Road. You'll love your stay!
reviews.title: Perfect B&B

likes.liked: — The rooms were hotel quality, but the place had a friendly and personal feel.

reviews.text: Stayed at Forty Putney overnight on my way to a business meeting but wish I could have stayed there for a week. The owners were extremely hospitable and the place was meticulously clean and well maintained. I felt completely at home and very well cared for. On arrival I was greeted with coffee and a tasty muffin. In the morning I had one of the most delicious breakfast I can remember - a highlight was the fresh homemade yoghurt, granola and tangy apple sauce, along with one of the lightest, tasty omelets one could imagine. Hats off to owners Tim and Amy to a wonderful B&B experience.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay at Forty Putney

likes.liked: — Meticulous cleanliness of rooms, friendly owners

reviews.title: This is the place to stay in Brattleboro!

likes.liked: — Everything! Great room, wonderful hosts, terrific location, incredible food and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this wonderful place by chance and what a blessing it turned out to be! Tim and Amy Brady, the terrific young innkeepers are not only very welcoming, but they really go the extra mile for their guests. This is only our second B&B experience but any others we experience in the future will have to live up to Forty Putney Road!
reviews.title: Superb
Great B&B
reviews.text: Our room in this lovely French Chateau home was immaculate, cozy, had a fireplace and a great view looking down on the lovely garden. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom is charmingly old-fashioned, stocked with very nice toiletries and the softest towels we've ever had anywhere!

description: Walk to lively downtown Brattleboro from this comfortably elegant 6 room waterside B&B. Enjoy a complimentary 2 course gourmet breakfast each morning made fresh with local ingredients. In-house pub with large selection of local craft beers and wines. Hiking trails on property.
